{"step_by_step_thinking": "Firstly, the age of the mother is not the only factor that determines the risk of having a Down's syndrome baby. A blood test or an ultrasound (USG) can provide some information, but they are not definitive tests. The most definitive test is Chorionic villus sampling (CVS), which can detect chromosomal abnormalities like Down's syndrome.
